description.text: The Camino Frances is the most popular Camino route, running from Saint-Jean-Pied-de-Port in France to Santiago de Compostella.

pois.name: Real Colegiata de Santa Maria de Roncesvalles

accommodation.name: Don Jáuregui de Burguete Country Lodge

description.text: There is a free guided tour of the church of San Saturnin, followed by a prayer session at the oratorio.@en

notes.text: To start the tour, meet volunteer guides at the tourist office, near the town hall.@en

pois.name: Alto del Perdón@es
pois.description: On the summit is a long metal sculpture dedicated to pilgrims.

description.text: The "Mystery of Obanos" is a play staged occasionally in the main square with over 400 performers. The play is based on the life of St Felicia and her brother.@en

pois.name: The Wine Fountain@en
pois.description: Bodegas Irache winery has a fountain that produces both water and wine.@en

notes.text: The mass is held at the Chapel of the Holy Christ or Chapel of St Thecla. Both chapels are outside the fee-paying area and can be accessed from the Western façade, through the gate of St Mary.@en

description.text: Museum with displays on human evolution & the nearby Atapuerca fossil site.

description.text: This is the famous cross where you leave the stone the reopresents the sins that they carry.@en

notes.text: Leave only a stone. Anything else is regarded as rubbish and will be cleared away.@en

description.text: Tomás, "the last Knight Templar," welcomes each passing pilgrim at any time.@en

description.text: A national monument, the site where the Chevaliers of St. James settled in the 12th century.@en

legs.description: After rain, the ascent to Mt Perdón can be too muddy for cyclists
Via Santovenia de Oca and N120
Stairways not recommended in wet weather

routes.name: Camino Frances
routes.description: The main Camino route starting in Saint-Jean-Pied-de-Port to Santiago de Compostella

routes.name: Old Zarapuz Route
routes.description: Follow the old Camino route via the abandoned monastery at Zarapuz, rather than the modern route via Estella

routes.name: Burgos via N120
routes.description: An alternative route into Burgos that follows the N120. This route avoids the ascent over the Sierra de Atapuerca and is recommended for cyclists.

routes.name: Via Trajana
routes.description: An alternative route towards León that follows the well-preserved Roman road. This involves a 23km walk from Calzadilla de los Hermanillos to Mansilla de Las Mulas with little water, shade or facilities.

routes.name: Sarria via Samos
routes.description: An alternative route towards Sarria that allows a visit to the monastery at Samos.

route-logic.description: Changes for the old Zarapuz route
Changes for the Via Trajana route
